info.name: Meraki Dashboard API
info.description:
This collection of API calls provides an easy way to interact with a Cisco Meraki network. Update your environment variables to efficiently use the collection.

**Common Variables**
* X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key
* organizationId
* networkId
* baseUrl

A template has been provided that can be used to quickly import the variable names. You will still be responsible for filling in the values and missing variables as needed.

Checkout the [Meraki Postman Getting Started guide](https://create.meraki.io/build/meraki-postman-collection-getting-started/) for more information.


# Change Log
This log represents the updates to this Postman Collection. For more information on what's new, check out https://create.meraki.io/whats-new/

## January 2019
### Clients
**Provisions a client with a name and policy. Clients can be provisioned before they associate to the network.**
- POST /networks/[networkId]/clients/provision

### Content filtering categories
**List all available content filtering categories for an MX network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/contentFiltering/categories

### Content filtering rules
**Update the content filtering settings for an MX network**
- PUT /networks/[networkId]/contentFiltering

**Return the content filtering settings for an MX network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/contentFiltering

## December 2018

### Devices
**Get the uplink loss percentage and latency in milliseconds for a wired network device.** 
- GET /networks/[networkId]/devices/[serial]/lossAndLatencyHistory

### Firewalled services

**List the appliance services and their accessibility rules**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/firewalledServices

**Return the accessibility settings of the given service ('ICMP', 'web', or 'SNMP')**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/firewalledServices/[service]

**Updates the accessibility settings for the given service ('ICMP', 'web', or 'SNMP')**
- PUT /networks/[networkId]/firewalledServices/[service]

### Sense (MV Camera Analytics)
**Returns an overview of aggregate analytics data for a timespan**
- GET /devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/overview

**Returns all configured analytic zones for this camera**
- GET /devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/zones

**Return historical records for analytic zones**
- GET /devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/zones/[zoneId]/history

**Returns most recent record for analytics zones**
- GET /devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/recent

**Returns live state from camera of analytics zones**
- GET /devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/live

### Splash settings
**Display the splash page settings for the given SSID**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/ssids/[number]/splashSettings

**Modify the splash page settings for the given SSID**
- PUT /networks/[networkId]/ssids/[number]/splashSettings

### Organizations - third party VPN Settings
**Return the third party VPN peers**
- GET /organizations/[id]/thirdPartyVPNPeers 
-- [Enhanced with IPSec policy parameters]

**Update the third party VPN peers**
- PUT /organizations/[id]/thirdPartyVPNPeers
-- [Enhanced with IPSec policy parameters]

## October 2018

### Alert Settings

**Return the alert configuration for this network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/alertSettings

**Update the alert configuration for this network**
- PUT /networks/[networkId]/alertSettings

### HTTP Servers
*Manage servers for Meraki Alerts with webhooks*

**List the HTTP servers for a network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/httpServers

**Return an HTTP server**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/httpServers/[id]

**Update an HTTP server**
- PUT /networks/[networkId]/httpServers/[id]

**Add an HTTP server**
- POST /networks/[networkId]/httpServers

**Delete an HTTP server**
- DEL /networks/[networkId]/httpServers/[id]

**Send a test webhook** 
- POST /networks/[networkId]/httpServers/webhookTests

**Return the status of a webhook test**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/httpServers/webhookTests/[id]

### Wireless Health
**Aggregated connectivity info for this network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/connectionStats

**Aggregated connectivity info for this network, grouped by node**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/devices/connectionStats

**Aggregated connectivity info for a given AP on this network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/devices/[serial]/connectionStats

**Aggregated connectivity info for this network, grouped by clients**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/clients/connectionStats

**Aggregated connectivity info for a given client on this network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/clients/[clientId]/connectionStats

**Aggregated latency info for this network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/latencyStats

**Aggregated latency info for this network, grouped by node**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/devices/latencyStats

**Aggregated latency info for a given AP on this network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/devices/[serial]/latencyStats

**Aggregated latency info for this network, grouped by clients**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/clients/latencyStats

**Aggregated latency info for a given client on this network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/clients/[clientId]/latencyStats

**List of all failed client connection events on this network in a given time**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/failedConnections

### VLANs
**Enable/Disable VLANs for the given network**
- PUT /networks/[networkId]/vlansEnabledState

## September 2018

### Syslog Servers
**List the syslog servers for a network**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/syslogServers

**Update the syslog servers for a network**
- PUT /networks/[networkId]/syslogServers

**Returns video link for the specified camera. If a timestamp supplied, it links to that time.**
- GET /devices/[serial]/cameras/video_link

**List LLDP and CDP information for a device**
- GET /networks/[networkId]/devices/[serial]/lldp_cdp

## June 2018
- GET /networks/[id]/splashLoginAttempts

### Clients
- GET /networks/:id/clients/:mac/
- GET /networks/:id/clients/:mac/usageHistory
- GET /networks/:id/clients/:mac/trafficHistory
- GET /networks/:id/clients/:mac/events
- GET /networks/:id/clients/:mac/securityEvents
- GET /networks/[networkId]/clients/[id_or_mac_or_ip]/latencyHistory

### Bluetooth Clients
- GET /networks/:id/bluetoothClients[/:mac]

### Meraki Auth
- GET /networks/:id/merakiAuthUsers[/:email]

### Network
- GET /networks/:id/splashLoginAttempts?loginIdentifier=:email_or_username

### PII (GDPR)
- updated endpoints to support both network and organization variations. 

## May 2018
- Personal Identifying Information endpoints (may require Meraki Support request)
- General cleanup. Adjusted endpoint names by removing their endpoint group name ("Networks - get all networks.. --> "get all networks")
- Updated all endpoints with a `{{baseUrl}}` environment variable. This makes it easier to test API proxies, mocks, or target a Meraki Cloud shard (i.e. "n123.meraki.com")
- Included a Template Environment for a quicker start

## Apr 2018
- Organization Device Summary Status 
  * List the status of every Meraki device in the organization. 
	-Returns a single array of all devices.

##  Mar 2018
- MX cellular firewall rules
  * Return cellular firewall rules
  * Update cellular firewall rules

## Feb 2018
- Clone Network
  * Use the **Create a Network** endpoint with the `copyFromNetworkId` parameter to create a new network with the same settings as the source network.

## Nov 2017
- MX VPN Firewall Rules
  * Return the firewall rules for an org
  * Upate the firewall rules of an org

## Oct 2017
- Group Policy support
  * Bind a client to a Group Policy
  * List Group Policies for a Network
- MX L3 Firewalls
  * Return L3 Firewall Rules
  * Update L3 Firewall Rules
- Bluetooth Settings
  * Return Bluetooth Settings
  * Update Bluetooth Settings
- Splash authorization
  * Return Splash Authorization status
  * Update Splash Authorization status
- Update the SNMP settings for an organization
- Phone Assignments
  * List all phones in a network and their contact assignment
  * Return a phone's contact assignment
  * Assign a contact and number(s) to a phone
  * Remove a phone assignment (unprovision a phone)

# Documentation and Resources
https://api.meraki.com/api_docs
https://create.meraki.io

# Troubleshooting
- Check your profile permissions. If you can't do it in Dashboard, you won't be able to in the API.

- Some calls seem to work better if you use the shard number instead of "dashboard" because of a required redirect. Just update the shard that matches when you login to the web Dashboard. It will be in the URL.

**Original**
```
- https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/{{networkId}}/ssids/{{ssidNum}}?name=viaAPI345&number={{ssidNum}}
```
**With shard number**
```
- https://n123.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/{{networkId}}/ssids/{{ssidNum}}?name=viaAPI345&number={{ssidNum}}
```

item.name: List the dashboard administrators in this organization

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /organizations/[organization_id]/admins
```

## PARAMETERS
**None**

### SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X GET 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/organizations/[organization_id]/admins'
```

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200

[
  {
    "id": "212406",
    "name": "Miles Meraki",
    "email": "miles@meraki.com",
    "orgAccess": "none",
    "tags": [
      {
        "tag": "west",
        "access": "read-only"
      }
    ],
    "networks": [
      {
        "id": "N_24329156",
        "access": "full"
      }
    ]
  }
]
```

response.name: List the dashboard administrators in this organization

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
POST /organizations/[organization_id]/admins
```

## PARAMETERS
**parameters**|**Description of the parameter**
 :-------------: |:-------------:
email|The email of the dashboard administrator. This attribute can not be updated.
name|The name of the dashboard administrator
orgAccess|The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the organization (full, read-only, none)
tags|The list of tags that the dashboard administrator has privileges on
tag|The name of the tag
access|The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the tag
networks|The list of networks that the dashboard administrator has privileges on
id|The network ID
access|The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the network

### SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X POST --data-binary '{"name":"Miles Meraki","email":"miles@meraki.com","orgAccess":"none","tags":[{"tag":"west","access":"read-only"}]}' 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/organizations/[organization_id]/admins'
```

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 201
{
  "id": "212406",
  "name": "Miles Meraki",
  "email": "miles@meraki.com",
  "orgAccess": "none",
  "tags": [
    {
      "tag": "west",
      "access": "read-only"
    }
  ],
  "networks": [
    {
      "id": "N_24329156",
      "access": "full"
    }
  ]
}
```

## HTTP REQUEST
```
PUT /organizations/[organization_id]/admins/[id]
```

## PARAMETERS
**parameters**|**Description of the parameter**
 :-------------: |:-------------:
email|The email of the dashboard administrator. This attribute can not be updated.
name|The name of the dashboard administrator
orgAccess|The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the organization (full, read-only, none)
tags|The list of tags that the dashboard administrator has privileges on
tag|The name of the tag
access|The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the tag
networks|The list of networks that the dashboard administrator has privileges on
id|The network ID
access|The privilege of the dashboard administrator on the network

### SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -X PUT -H 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-binary '{"name":"Miles Meraki", "email":"miles@meraki.com", "orgAccess":"read-only", "tags":[{"tag":"west", "access":"read-only"}]}' 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/organizations/1234/admins/1234'
```

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "id":"212406",
  "name":"Miles Meraki",
  "email":"miles@meraki.com",
  "orgAccess":"read-only",
  "tags":[
    {
      "tag":"west",
      "access":"read-only"
    }
  ],
  "networks":[]
}
```

item.name: Revoke all access for a dashboard administrator within this organization

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
DELETE /organizations/[organization_id]/admins/[id]
```

## PARAMETERS
**None**

### SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X DELETE 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/organizations/[organization_id]/admins/[id]'
```

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 204
```

response.name: Revoke all access for a dashboard administrator within this organization

item.name: Return the alert configuration for this network

response.name: Return the alert configuration for this network

item.name: Update the alert configuration for this network

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
PUT /networks/[networkId]/alertSettings
```
## PARAMETERS
**Name**|**Description**
 :-------------: |:-------------:
defaultDestinations| The network_wide destinations for all alerts on the network.
emails| A list of emails that will recieve the alert(s).
allAdmins| If true, then all network admins will receive emails.
snmp| If true, then an SNMP trap will be sent if there is an SNMP trap server configured for this network.
alerts| Alert-specific configuration for each type. Only alerts that pertain to the network can be updated.
type| The type of alert
enabled| A boolean depicting if the alert is turned on or off
alertDestinations| A hash of destinations for this specific alert. Keys include: emails: A list of emails that will recieve information about the alert, allAdmins: If true, then all network admins will receive emails, and snmp: If true, then an SNMP trap will be sent if there is an SNMP trap server configured for this network.
filters| A hash of specific configuration data for the alert. Only filters specific to the alert will be updated.

## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X PUT --data-binary '{"defaultDestinations":{"emails":["miles@meraki.com"],"allAdmins":true,"snmp":true},"alerts":[{"type":"gatewayDown","enabled":true,"alertDestinations":{"emails":["miles@meraki.com"],"allAdmins":false,"snmp":false},"filters":{"timeout":60}}]}' 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[networkId]/alertSettings'
```
## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200

{
  "defaultDestinations": {
    "emails": [
      "miles@meraki.com"
    ],
    "allAdmins": true,
    "snmp": true
  },
  "alerts": [
    {
      "type": "gatewayDown",
      "enabled": true,
      "alertDestinations": {
        "emails": [
          "miles@meraki.com"
        ],
        "allAdmins": false,
        "snmp": false
      },
      "filters": {
        "timeout": 60
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

response.name: Update the alert configuration for this network

item.name: Returns all configured analytic zones for this camera

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/zones
```

## PARAMETERS
**None**

### SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X GET 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/zones'
```

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200

[
  {
    "id": "0",
    "type": "occupancy",
    "label": "Full Frame"
  }
]
```

response.name: Returns all configured analytic zones for this camera

item.name: Returns live state from camera of analytics zones

item.name: Returns an overview of aggregate analytics data for a timespan

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /devices/[serial]/camera/analytics/overview
```

## PARAMETERS
**Parameter**|**Description**
 :-------------: |:-------------:
timespan| The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and less than or equal to a week (604800 seconds).
t0| The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 12 months from today.
t1| The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a max of 1 week after t0.

### SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X GET 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/devices/{serial}/camera/analytics/overview
```

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200

[
  {
    "startTs": "2018-08-15T18:32:38.123Z",
    "endTs": "2018-08-15T18:33:38.123Z",
    "zoneId": 0,
    "entrances": 254,
    "averageCount": 5
  }
]
```

response.name: Returns an overview of aggregate analytics data for a timespan

item.name: Return historical records for analytic zones

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /devices/{serial}/camera/analytics/zones/{zoneId}/history
```

## PARAMETERS
**Parameter**|**Description**
 :-------------: |:-------------:
perPage| The number of entries per page returned
startingAfter| A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, next or prev page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
endingBefore| A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, next or prev page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

### SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X GET 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/devices/{serial}/camera/analytics/zones/{zoneId}/history'
```

### SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200

[
  {
    "startTs": "2018-08-15T18:32:38.123Z",
    "endTs": "2018-08-15T18:33:38.123Z",
    "entrances": 5,
    "averageCount": 1.5
  }
]
```

response.name: Return historical records for analytic zones

item.name: List the Bluetooth clients seen by APs in this network

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /networks/[networkId]/bluetoothClients
```
## QUERY PARAMETERS
**Parameter**|**Description**
:-------------: |:-------------:
timespan| The timespan, in seconds, used to look back from now for bluetooth clients
includeConnectivityHistory| Include the connectivity history for this client
perPage| The number of entries per page returned
startingAfter| A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, next or prev page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
endingBefore| A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, next or prev page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X GET 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[networkId]/bluetoothClients?perPage=20'
```
## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
[
    {
        "id": "643451796760123123",
        "mac": "7c:d1:c3:26:aa:aa",
        "networkId": "L_643451796760560141",
        "name": null,
        "deviceName": "",
        "manufacturer": "Apple",
        "lastSeen": 1528257331,
        "seenByDeviceMac": "88:15:44:60:aa:aa",
        "inSightAlert": false,
        "outOfSightAlert": false,
        "tags": []
    },
    {
        "id": "643451796760123124",
        "mac": "7c:04:d0:d3:bb:bb",
        "networkId": "L_643451796760500000",
        "name": null,
        "deviceName": "",
        "manufacturer": "Apple",
        "lastSeen": 1528260960,
        "seenByDeviceMac": "88:15:44:60:aa:aa",
        "inSightAlert": false,
        "outOfSightAlert": false,
        "tags": []
    },
```

response.name: List the Bluetooth clients seen by APs in this network

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Link
header.description: Used to express a typed relationship with another resource, where the relation type is defined by RFC 5988

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Rack-Cache
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Request-Id
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Runtime
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-UA-Compatible
header.description: Custom header

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /networks/[networkId]/bluetoothClients/[id]
```
## PARAMETERS
**Parameter**|**Description**
:-------------: |:-------------:
includeConnectivityHistory| Include the connectivity history for this client
connectivityHistoryTimespan| The timespan, in seconds, for the connectivityHistory data. By default 1 day, 86400, will be used.
## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X GET 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/networks/[networkId]/bluetoothClients/[id]'
```
## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200
{
  "mac": "00:11:22:33:44:55",
  "networkId": "N_24329156"
}
```

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-Rack-Cache
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Request-Id
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Runtime
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-UA-Compatible
header.description: Custom header

item.name: Returns video link for the specified camera. If a timestamp supplied, it links to that time.

request.description:
## HTTP REQUEST
```
GET /devices/[serial]/cameras/video_link
```
## PARAMETERS
**Parameter**|**Description**
 :-------------: |:-------------:
timestamp| The video link will start at this timestamp. The timestamp is in UNIX Epoch time (milliseconds).

## SAMPLE REQUEST
```
curl -L -H 'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key: <key>' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X GET 'https://api.meraki.com/api/v0/devices/[serial]/cameras/video_link'
```
## SAMPLE RESPONSE
```
Successful HTTP Status: 200

"https://nxx.meraki.com/office-cameras/n/bs0a1k/manage/nodes/new_list/29048243992402"
```

response.name: Returns video link for the specified camera. If a timestamp supplied, it links to that time.
